intro: Tessaria dentata, commonly known as the toothed tessaria, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its distinctive toothed leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or shaded areas. Due to its unique morphology and ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
